summary: A letter from a French victim to the U.S. Department of Justice and Judge Loretta Preska, dated November 12, 2019. The writer details extensive allegations of childhood sexual abuse, trafficking, and harassment by an international network involving Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, Jean Luc Brunel, and others. The letter requests international investigation, evidence checks, and inclusion in U.S. civil proceedings, while criticizing French authorities for inaction and statute of limitations issues.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: Addressed as the U.S. Minister of Justice in the letter's header, indicating the document is directed to the U.S. Department of Justice.

persons.name: Loretta A. Preska
persons.context: Addressed as the Honorable Judge, recipient of the letter alongside the U.S. Department of Justice.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure accused of rape, trafficking, and abuse of the victim as a child across multiple properties. Described as deceased.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named in the complaint for complicity in the Epstein network. Mentioned in the context of possibly being heard laughing during abuse.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Named in the complaint filed in France. Implicated as part of the Epstein-Brunel-Maxwell trio involved in child trafficking.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Named in the complaint for complicity within the Epstein-Maxwell-Brunel network.

persons.name: Remy Heitz
persons.role: Prosecutor of the Republic of Paris
persons.context: French prosecutor to whom the victim filed a complaint on September 11, 2019.

persons.name: Marlene Schiappa
persons.role: Secretary of State to the French Prime Minister
persons.context: Criticized for hindering the investigation by denying rapes occurred in France and for not supporting victims.

persons.name: Jean Sebastien Bertran
persons.context: Named as an accomplice. Described as being present during the victim's transport and involved in harassment.

persons.name: Sylvain Cormier
persons.context: Described as a lawyer who assaulted the victim, associated with Franck Ribery, and involved in harassment and intimidation.

persons.name: Franck Ribery
persons.context: Allegedly part of a harassment network, attempted to assault the victim, and is linked to prostitution.

persons.name: Maud Bourdin
persons.context: Accomplice of Sylvain Cormier, involved in harassment, threats, and falsely reporting the victim to police.

persons.name: Nadine de Rothschild
persons.context: Encountered by the victim; her car was used by Sylvain Cormier, and the victim was pressured to approach her.

persons.name: Agnes Dalbin
persons.context: Cousin of the victim who bullied her and is friends with the Balkany family; part of the alleged harassment network.

persons.name: Patrick Balkany
persons.context: Mentioned as someone Agnes Dalbin frequents; he contacted the victim as part of alleged intimidation.

persons.name: Benjamin Biolay
persons.context: Allegedly part of the harassment network, seen near the victim's home in 2013.

persons.name: Jean Marie Bigard
persons.context: Described as disturbing and violent; made rape jokes in front of children and later searched for the victim's coordinates.

persons.name: Roman Polanski
persons.context: Mentioned as being protected by France from extradition; supported by Sylvain Cormier.

persons.name: Brigitte Bardot
persons.context: Her animal charity equestrian team arrived at the victim's home as part of alleged harassment.

persons.name: Jocelyne Calvisio
persons.context: Accused of enabling the victim's sexual assault by Jean Sebastien Bertran and making threats.

persons.name: Patrice Lafont
persons.context: Present with Jean Sebastien Bertran and Jean Marie Bigard; laughed at rape jokes.

persons.name: Christian Cluesada
persons.context: Mentioned as part of the network of stars involved in harassment.

persons.name: Adil Rami
persons.context: Mentioned as part of the network of stars involved in harassment.

persons.name: Pascal Obispo
persons.context: Mentioned as part of the network of stars involved in harassment between 1997-1999.

persons.name: Gerard Lanvin
persons.context: Allegedly showed violence towards the victim and told her to leave Maud Bourdin alone.

persons.name: Michel Drucker
persons.context: Mentioned as part of the network of stars involved in harassment around 2007.

persons.name: Clementine
persons.context: Named in the letter header as part of 'The Family' with complicity in the network.

persons.name: Donato
persons.context: Named in the letter header as part of 'The Family' with complicity in the network.

persons.name: Lucienne
persons.context: Named in the letter header as part of 'The Family' with complicity in the network.

persons.name: Jocelyne
persons.context: Named in the letter header as part of 'The Family' with complicity in the network.

persons.name: Louis
persons.context: Named in the letter header as part of 'The Family' with complicity in the network.

connections.description: Described as part of the Epstein-Brunel-Maxwell trio involved in child trafficking and abuse.
Described as part of the Epstein-Brunel-Maxwell trio involved in child trafficking and abuse.
Prince Andrew is named in the complaint for complicity within the Epstein network.
Sylvain Cormier acted on behalf of Franck Ribery, including assaulting the victim at his request.
Described as companions involved in joint harassment and intimidation of the victim.
Agnes Dalbin frequents the Balkany couple, and Patrick Balkany contacted the victim as part of alleged intimidation.
Jocelyne Calvisio enabled the victim's sexual assault by leaving her alone with Jean Sebastien Bertran.
Sylvain Cormier is described as supporting Roman Polanski.

events.title: Complaint filed in Paris
events.description: The victim filed a complaint via recommended letter to Prosecutor Remy Heitz in Paris against Jean Luc Brunel, Ghislaine Maxwell, and Prince Andrew for complicity.

events.title: Second complaint filing
events.description: The victim filed another complaint in person, with an interview lasting two and a half hours.

events.title: Letter to U.S. DOJ
events.description: The victim writes to U.S. Attorney General William Barr and Judge Loretta Preska detailing allegations and requesting international investigation.

events.title: FBI raid on Little Saint James
events.description: Reference to videos of rape children recovered by the FBI on the island of Saint James in 2008.

events.title: Victim's birth
events.description: The victim's date of birth is provided, establishing eligibility under extended statute of limitations for sexual crimes against minors in France.

events.title: Harassment by network associates
events.description: Multiple incidents of harassment by figures like Benjamin Biolay, Franck Ribery, and others near the victim's home.

events.title: Assault by Sylvain Cormier
events.description: Sylvain Cormier, then a trainee lawyer, violently restrained the victim and was later seen with Nadine de Rothschild.

locations: New York or Washington, D.C., USA
keyFacts: The writer is a French victim alleging childhood sexual abuse, trafficking, and repeated rape by Jeffrey Epstein and an international network.

The victim filed formal complaints in France in September 2019 against Jean Luc Brunel, Ghislaine Maxwell, and Prince Andrew, but expresses frustration with French authorities citing statute of limitations and lack of action.
The letter requests the U.S. Department of Justice to investigate, obtain international arrest warrants, freeze Epstein's assets, and include French victims in U.S. civil proceedings.
The victim describes being abused at multiple Epstein properties (islands, a skyscraper, a house in Florida) and details specific abusive rituals involving other children.
The document alleges a wide-ranging harassment network in France involving lawyers, celebrities, athletes, and public figures who intimidated the victim over many years.
